title: Charles: Who is the new King?
description: Charles has become the King. Take a look back at some of the key moments that have shaped his life.

title: Queen Elizabeth II and Africa: In pictures
description: Queen Elizabeth visited more than 20 African countries during her reign, as the British Empire ended and independence swept the continent.

title: Sweden election: Gang shootings cast shadow over vote
description: Violent crime is a top issue for voters going to the polls on Sunday.

title: Charles III to be proclaimed king at historic ceremony
description: The first televised Accession Council comes as the King pledges to follow his mother's life of service.

title: The Papers: King's 'pledge to the nation' and 'my darling mama'
description: The UK press reflect on the end of an era, in their first editions after the Queen's death.

title: US Open: Casper Ruud beats Karen Khachanov to reach New York final
description: Norway's Casper Ruud continues his bid for a first major title - and the world number one ranking - by beating Russia's Karen Khachanov to reach the US Open final.

title: In pictures: Sydney darkens opera house as world mourns
description: Condolences pour in from around the globe following news of the British monarch's death.

title: 'She was a neighbour, more than just the Queen'
description: Villagers in Ballater, near Balmoral, regarded the Queen as a friendly member of their community.

title: Energy price cap: Questions firms need answers to
description: Firms will get energy price support for six months, but they say many questions remain unanswered.

title: William and Kate made Prince and Princess of Wales
description: King Charles III names William and his wife Catherine as the Prince and Princess of Wales.

title: US Open: Joe Salisbury & Rajeev Ram become first pair this century to retain men's doubles title
description: Britain's Joe Salisbury and America's Rajeev Ram become the first pair this century to retain the US Open men's doubles title.

title: The grand ceremony announcing Charles as new king
description: The new king is due to be proclaimed by an Accession Council. What exactly is this?

title: Queen Elizabeth II: Children remember 'that fantastic twinkle'
description: Wearing the crown at bath time and "that" 007 cameo - the Queen's children share treasured memories.

title: Chris Kaba: Police shooting of unarmed man treated as homicide
description: The police watchdog said this "does not mean that criminal charges will necessarily follow".

title: WATCH: Inside King Charles' first audience with PM Liz Truss
description: Footage from inside the first audience with the British head of state and prime minister is rare.

title: King Charles III's address to the nation and Commonwealth in full
description: King Charles III delivers his first public broadcast as monarch following the death of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II.

title: What are the new titles for the Royal Family?
description: The Royal Family is changing after the death of the Queen - and so are their titles.

title: King Charles' emotional thanks to 'darling mama' Queen Elizabeth II
description: King Charles III said "may flights of angels sing thee to thy rest" in his emotional message.

title: England bosses Sarina Wiegman and Gareth Southgate pay tribute to 'inspirational' Queen
description: England women's manager Sarina Wiegman says the Queen inspired as "a mother figure for people to seek stability and peace from in uncertain times".

title: World media marks the death of Queen Elizabeth II
description: News outlets around the world reflect on Queen Elizabeth's influence and the impact of her death.

title: Football stops across UK 'to honour Queen's extraordinary life'
description: Domestic football, from the Premier League to grassroots, will not take place in most of the UK this weekend after Queen Elizabeth II died aged 96.

title: King Charles III: Cheers and kisses as new King heads to Buckingham Palace
description: The new monarch gets a warm reception from crowds as he arrives at Buckingham Palace as King.

title: Ukraine weapons: What military equipment is the world giving?
description: Military equipment is pouring into Ukraine, but President Zelensky says more is needed to stop Russia.

title: In pictures: King Charles' first full day on the throne
description: King Charles III looked thoughtful as he left Balmoral, before being greeted by crowds at Buckingham Palace.

title: Six times the Queen made us laugh
description: The Queen's role in public life was a serious one, but she sometimes showed us her funny side.

title: Bank of England delays interest rate decision after Queen's death
description: The UK's central bank postpones its meeting by a week "in light of the period of national mourning".

title: Watch: King met with cheers outside palace
description: Huge crowds awaited the new King as he arrived with the Queen Consort.

title: Man admits stabbing Bermondsey family of four but denies murder
description: Joshua Jacques has admitted manslaughter by reason of diminished responsibility.

title: Notes to Queen Elizabeth II: Paddington bears, memories and messages
description: People have been leaving drawings and messages for Queen Elizabeth II at the gates of Buckingham Palace.

title: England v South Africa: Third Test to resume on Saturday
description: The deciding Test match between England and South Africa will resume on Saturday 10 September following the death of Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Max Verstappen joins Lewis Hamilton near back of Italian GP grid after penalty
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen is handed a five-place grid penalty for the Italian Grand Prix.

title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Tenth arrest in murder probe
description: An 18-year-old man from Liverpool is being held on suspicion of assisting an offender.

title: Outpouring of sympathy across the Commonwealth
description: From prime ministers to people on the street, the Commonwealth nations pay tribute to the Queen.

title: Camilla, the new Queen Consort
description: Camilla, the wife of the new king, has been at his side for many years, but admits it has not been easy.

title: PM Liz Truss opens tributes to Queen Elizabeth II in Parliament
description: The Commons and Lords will sit for two days, as MPs and peers mark the death of Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Premiership Rugby: Start of season delayed until Saturday following death of Queen Elizabeth II
description: The start of the new Premiership Rugby season will begin on Saturday, following the death of Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Wales and Scotland discover World Cup play-off opponents
description: Wales will host Bosnia-Herzegovina in the World Cup play-off semi-finals, while Scotland are at home to Austria.

title: St Leger moved to Sunday as Saturday meetings called off after Queen's death
description: Saturday's racing in Britain is cancelled as a mark of respect following the Queen's death, with the St Leger moved to Sunday.

title: What kind of a King will Charles be?
description: How will a former prince used to speaking out on issues he felt passionate about adapt to the neutrality of a monarch?

title: Energy firms will contact customers over bill cuts
description: Households will be told how the plan to reduce energy bills announced by Liz Truss will affect them.

title: Manchester IRA 1996 bomb: Man arrested at Birmingham Airport
description: The suspect was detained at Birmingham Airport on Thursday evening, police say.

title: Premier League games off following Queen's death
description: All English and Northern Irish football and all professional Scottish football has been postponed this weekend as a mark of respect following the death of Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Ukraine has retaken 1,000 square kilometres in a week - Zelensky
description: Kyiv says a lightning counteroffensive has recaptured vast swathes of territory in its south and east.

title: Porsche call off Formula 1 collaboration with Red Bull after talks breakdown
description: Porsche will not enter Formula 1 as an engine partner to Red Bull after talks stall.

title: Ukraine war: Heavily pregnant medic held in Russian prison
description: The family of Mariana Mamonova are calling for her release before her due date at the end September.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: Gun salutes and floral tributes as UK mourns
description: King Charles III is expected to address the nation for the first time as sovereign later.

title: Royal rebranding: What will happen to stamps, coins, banknotes and passports?
description: We're used to seeing Queen Elizabeth II's portrait and coat of arms in our change and on cereal boxes.

title: US Open: Frances Tiafoe, Carlos Alcaraz, Casper Ruud & Karen Khachanov aiming for final
description: Frances Tiafoe will aim to become the first American man to reach the US Open final since 2006 when he plays Carlos Alcaraz in the last four.

title: UN: Ukraine must give disabled people 'family life'
description: A UN committee is calling for the release of disabled people locked away in Ukrainian orphanages.

title: North Korea declares itself a nuclear weapons state
description: Leader Kim Jong-un says this is "irreversible" and rules out the possibility of denuclearisation.

title: Death of Queen Elizabeth II: Will there be a bank holiday and will schools close?
description: Strikes are cancelled, some sport is postponed, and a bank holiday is expected.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: The moment the Buckingham Palace crowds learned the news
description: The flag was lowered, and shock spread among the crowd that gathered outside.

title: US Open: Ons Jabeur beats Caroline Garcia to reach final in New York
description: Tunisia's Ons Jabeur reaches her second successive major final after a straight-set win over France's Caroline Garcia in the US Open semi-finals.

title: Self-sterilising plastic kills viruses like Covid
description: The researchers think their plastic could help stop viruses spreading in hospitals.
